alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 5:09PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Douglas, southwestern Denver and central Jefferson Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tiny Town, or 17 miles southwest of Denver, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Denver, southern Lakewood, northwestern Highlands Ranch, Littleton, western Englewood, Evergreen, Roxborough Park, Sheridan, Morrison, Idledale, Tiny Town, Chatfield Reservoir, Kittredge, Red Rocks Park, Indian Hills and Aspen Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
